intro: Randia decora, commonly known as the pretty randia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and clusters of small, white or pink flowers. It typically grows as an herbaceous perennial or shrub, often reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Randia decora is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in warm, humid climates.
